roleset.name: oppose, halt, stop, block up, stopping up
roleset.note: BLOCKAGE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry block.01, same as block-n. Framed by Anwen Feb 2011 (from blockage.01-n)

roles.note: Frames file for 'block' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'stop'. VN classes concealment-16, fill-9.8, forbid-67. (from block.01-v) Roleset based on verb entry block.01, OntoNotes grouping block-n sense 10; VN classes concealment-16, fill-9.8, forbid-67. Framed by Claire. (from block.01-n)

role.descr: secondary predication, arg1 stopped from what, where relevant
Instrument, blcked with what? stuff acting as block

example.name: simple transitive
example.text: It's now easier for the Transportation Department to block leveraged buy-outs in the airline industry.
example.arg: leveraged buy-outs in the airline industry.

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: Low test scores can block students' promotions.

example.name: with secondary predication
example.text: [The proposed Soviet redefinition]-2 is aimed at *trace*-2 blocking the US from developing lighter, more transportable high-technology tanks.
example.arg: from developing lighter, more transportable high-technology tanks

example.name: everything all together
example.text: John blocked Mary from completing her dissertation with his constant pestering.

example.name: Args 0 & 1
example.text: The goalie's block of the kick prevented the offense from scoring.

example.name: Args 0, 1, MNR
example.text: The senator's effective block of the bill angered the president.

example.name: Arg 3
example.text: The accident caused a traffic block on the bridge for hours.

example.name: Args 0, 1, 2
example.text: The faculty's texting block on students caused an uproar, but led to better GPAs.

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Elfabala's blocking of the proposed construction got her arrested.

example.name: Arg1
example.text: Patient Jane has a blockage of at least one of her vessels.
example.arg: of at least one of her vessels

roleset.name: oppose, halt, stop
roleset.note: BLOCK_UP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'block up' based on sentences in ebc. (from block.02-v predicate notes)

example.text: Waste discharged * has currently blocked this up.
